section.p: A swaggering Sokaran captain marches on board with a complement of marines.
‘I don’t think you’ve paid your harbour duties,’ he says.
‘Harbour duties! We’re in the middle of the sea!’ you exclaim angrily.
The captain smiles smugly at you. ‘You’d better cough up 50 Shards, or I’ll impound your ship and its cargo.’
‘But that’s no better than common piracy!’ says your first mate, outraged.
‘The duty will be 60 Shards now, for calling a captain in the Sokaran Imperial Navy a pirate!’ he sneers.
Several of his men burst into laughter.
